```diff
          document.getElementById(&#39;modal-overlay&#39;).classList.add(&#39;hidden&#39;);
      };
+ 
+     // Physics Simulation for Floating Buttons
+     const floatButtons = document.querySelectorAll(&#39;.float-btn&#39;);
+     const physicsObjects = [];
+     const buttonRadius = 50; // Half of 100px width
+     const friction = 0.995;
+     const bounceDamping = 0.8;
+     
+     // Initialize physics objects
+     floatButtons.forEach((btn, index) =&gt; {
+         const angle = (index / floatButtons.length) * Math.PI * 2;
+         const centerX = window.innerWidth / 2;
+         const centerY = window.innerHeight / 2;
+         const spreadRadius = Math.min(window.innerWidth, window.innerHeight) * 0.25;
+         
+         const obj = {
+             el: btn,
+             x: centerX + Math.cos(angle) * spreadRadius,
+             y: centerY + Math.sin(angle) * spreadRadius,
+             vx: (Math.random() - 0.5) * 3,
+             vy: (Math.random() - 0.5) * 3,
+             radius: buttonRadius
+         };
+         
+         physicsObjects.push(obj);
+         
+         // Set initial position
+         btn.style.left = obj.x - buttonRadius + &#39;px&#39;;
+         btn.style.top = obj.y - buttonRadius + &#39;px&#39;;
+     });
+     
+     // Check collision between two circles
+     function checkCollision(a, b) {
+         const dx = b.x - a.x;
+         const dy = b.y - a.y;
+         const dist = Math.sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy);
+         return dist &lt; a.radius + b.radius;
+     }
+     
+     // Resolve collision between two circles
+     function resolveCollision(a, b) {
+         const dx = b.x - a.x;
+         const dy = b.y - a.y;
+         const dist = Math.sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy);
+         
+         if (dist === 0) return; // Avoid division by zero
+         
+         // Normal vector
+         const nx = dx / dist;
+         const ny = dy / dist;
+         
+         // Relative velocity
+         const dvx = a.vx - b.vx;
+         const dvy = a.vy - b.vy;
+         
+         // Relative velocity along normal
+         const dvn = dvx * nx + dvy * ny;
+         
+         // Don&#39;t resolve if moving apart
+         if (dvn &lt; 0) return;
+         
+         // Update velocities (equal mass)
+         a.vx -= dvn * nx;
+         a.vy -= dvn * ny;
+         b.vx += dvn * nx;
+         b.vy += dvn * ny;
+         
+         // Separate overlapping circles
+         const overlap = (a.radius + b.radius - dist) / 2;
+         a.x -= overlap * nx;
+         a.y -= overlap * ny;
+         b.x += overlap * nx;
+         b.y += overlap * ny;
+     }
+     
+     // Physics update loop
+     function updatePhysics() {
+         const width = window.innerWidth;
+         const height = window.innerHeight;
+         
+         // Update positions
+         physicsObjects.forEach(obj =&gt; {
+             obj.x += obj.vx;
+             obj.y += obj.vy;
+             
+             // Apply friction
+             obj.vx *= friction;
+             obj.vy *= friction;
+             
+             // Wall collisions
+             if (obj.x - obj.radius &lt; 0) {
+                 obj.x = obj.radius;
+                 obj.vx = -obj.vx * bounceDamping;
+             }
+             if (obj.x + obj.radius &gt; width) {
+                 obj.x = width - obj.radius;
+                 obj.vx = -obj.vx * bounceDamping;
+             }
+             if (obj.y - obj.radius &lt; 0) {
+                 obj.y = obj.radius;
+                 obj.vy = -obj.vy * bounceDamping;
+             }
+             if (obj.y + obj.radius &gt; height) {
+                 obj.y = height - obj.radius;
+                 obj.vy = -obj.vy * bounceDamping;
+             }
+         });
+         
+         // Check collisions between all pairs
+         for (let i = 0; i &lt; physicsObjects.length; i++) {
+             for (let j = i + 1; j &lt; physicsObjects.length; j++) {
+                 if (checkCollision(physicsObjects[i], physicsObjects[j])) {
+                     resolveCollision(physicsObjects[i], physicsObjects[j]);
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+         
+         // Apply random gentle forces to keep things moving
+         physicsObjects.forEach(obj =&gt; {
+             if (Math.random() &lt; 0.02) {
+                 obj.vx += (Math.random() - 0.5) * 0.5;
+                 obj.vy += (Math.random() - 0.5) * 0.5;
+             }
+         });
+         
+         // Update DOM
+         physicsObjects.forEach(obj =&gt; {
+             obj.el.style.left = (obj.x - obj.radius) + &#39;px&#39;;
+             obj.el.style.top = (obj.y - obj.radius) + &#39;px&#39;;
+         });
+         
+         requestAnimationFrame(updatePhysics);
+     }
+     
+     // Start physics simulation
+     updatePhysics();
+     
+     // Handle window resize
+     window.addEventListener(&#39;resize&#39;, () =&gt; {
+         const width = window.innerWidth;
+         const height = window.innerHeight;
+         
+         // Keep objects within bounds after resize
+         physicsObjects.forEach(obj =&gt; {
+             if (obj.x - obj.radius &lt; 0) obj.x = obj.radius;
+             if (obj.x + obj.radius &gt; width) obj.x = width - obj.radius;
+             if (obj.y - obj.radius &lt; 0) obj.y = obj.radius;
+             if (obj.y + obj.radius &gt; height) obj.y = height - obj.radius;
+         });
+     });
  });
```

Here's all the physics code (lines 516-673):

## Summary

### Constants (lines 517-522)
| Variable | Value | Effect |
|----------|-------|--------|
| `buttonRadius` | 50 | Size of collision circle |
| `gravity` | 0.12 | Downward acceleration per frame |
| `bounceDamping` | 0.85 | Energy retained on bounce (85%) |
| `clickForceStrength` | 20 | Push force when clicking |

### Forces Applied
1. **Gravity** (line 634): `obj.vy += gravity` — constant downward pull
2. **Click explosion** (lines 524-543): Push balls away from click point (within 400px radius)
3. **Ball-to-ball collision** (lines 582-620): Pushes overlapping balls apart + exchanges velocities
4. **Wall bounce** (lines 640-658): Reverses velocity × 0.85 when hitting edges
5. **Ground friction** (line 657): `obj.vx *= 0.98` — slows horizontal movement on floor

### Physics Loop (lines 622-669)
Each frame:
1. Add gravity to vertical velocity
2. Update position by velocity
3. Check/resolve wall collisions
4. Check/resolve ball-to-ball collisions
5. Update DOM positions

### Initialization (lines 545-564)
Buttons start in a circle around screen center, with zero velocity.

I've reimplemented the physics simulation based on your `physics.html` example. Here's what the new physics code includes:

**Key improvements from physics.html:**
1. **Time-based physics (dt)** - Uses `performance.now()` with delta time clamped to 32ms max for stable simulation
2. **Velocity in px/sec** - Velocities are now in pixels per second, not per frame
3. **Proper gravity scaling** - `gravity * 100 * dt` for px/s² calculation
4. **Air drag** - Frame-rate independent drag: `Math.pow(0.999, dt * 60)`
5. **Impulse-based collisions** - Proper elastic collision resolution with mass consideration

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
The user is asking what's causing the buttons to drift/float around their positions. Looking at the CSS, I can see it's the CSS keyframe animations applied to each button.</details></think>

---

The buttons drift around their positions due to **CSS keyframe animations**. Each button has an `animation` property that references a `@keyframes` rule:

```css
.float-1 {
    top: 30%;
    left: 15%;
    animation: float1 8s ease-in-out infinite;  /* <-- This causes the drift */
}
```

The `@keyframes` rules define how the `transform: translate()` values change over time:

```css
@keyframes float1 {
    0%, 100% { transform: translate(0, 0); }      /* Start/end at original position */
    25% { transform: translate(20px, -30px); }    /* Move right 20px, up 30px */
    50% { transform: translate(-10px, -50px); }   /* Move left 10px, up 50px */
    75% { transform: translate(30px, -20px); }    /* Move right 30px, up 20px */
}
```

**How it works:**
- `animation: float1 8s ease-in-out infinite` means:
  - Use the `float1` keyframes
  - Complete one full cycle in **8 seconds**
  - Use **ease-in-out** timing (smooth start and end)
  - Repeat **infinitely**

Each button has a different animation with slightly different:
- **Duration** (7s, 8s, 9s, 10s) - so they don't sync up
- **Movement patterns** - different translate values create unique paths

If you want to **remove the drifting**, you can either:
1. Remove the `animation` property from each `.float-X` class
2. Or delete the `@keyframes` rules entirely

```diff
@@ -508,4 +508,164 @@
          document.getElementById(&#39;modal-overlay&#39;).classList.add(&#39;hidden&#39;);
      };
+ 
+     // Physics Simulation - Click explosion only, no gravity
+     const floatButtons = document.querySelectorAll(&#39;.float-btn&#39;);
+     const balls = [];
+     
+     const physicsConfig = {
+         friction: 0.985,      // Slows down over time (1 = no friction)
+         elasticity: 0.9,      // Bounce factor for walls and collisions
+         clickForce: 500       // Impulse strength for click explosion
+     };
+     
+     // Get button radius from first button
+     function getButtonRadius() {
+         if (floatButtons.length === 0) return 50;
+         const rect = floatButtons[0].getBoundingClientRect();
+         return Math.max(rect.width, rect.height) / 2;
+     }
+     
+     // Initialize physics objects in a spread pattern
+     const buttonRadius = getButtonRadius();
+     floatButtons.forEach((btn, index) =&gt; {
+         const angle = (index / floatButtons.length) * Math.PI * 2 + Math.PI / 4;
+         const centerX = window.innerWidth / 2;
+         const centerY = window.innerHeight / 2;
+         const spreadRadius = Math.min(window.innerWidth, window.innerHeight) * 0.25;
+         
+         const ball = {
+             el: btn,
+             x: centerX + Math.cos(angle) * spreadRadius,
+             y: centerY + Math.sin(angle) * spreadRadius,
+             vx: 0,
+             vy: 0,
+             r: buttonRadius
+         };
+         
+         balls.push(ball);
+         btn.style.left = (ball.x - ball.r) + &#39;px&#39;;
+         btn.style.top = (ball.y - ball.r) + &#39;px&#39;;
+     });
+     
+     // Click explosion force - the only way to move buttons
+     document.addEventListener(&#39;click&#39;, (e) =&gt; {
+         if (e.target.classList.contains(&#39;float-btn&#39;)) return;
+         if (!pages.finish.classList.contains(&#39;active-page&#39;)) return;
+         if (!pages.finish.contains(e.target)) return;
+         
+         const clickX = e.clientX;
+         const clickY = e.clientY;
+         
+         balls.forEach(b =&gt; {
+             const dx = b.x - clickX;
+             const dy = b.y - clickY;
+             const dist = Math.hypot(dx, dy);
+             
+             if (dist &gt; 0 &amp;&amp; dist &lt; 500) {
+                 const force = physicsConfig.clickForce * (1 - dist / 500);
+                 b.vx += (dx / dist) * force;
+                 b.vy += (dy / dist) * force;
+             }
+         });
+     });
+     
+     // Ball-to-ball collision
+     function resolveCollision(a, b) {
+         const dx = b.x - a.x;
+         const dy = b.y - a.y;
+         const dist = Math.hypot(dx, dy);
+         const minDist = a.r + b.r;
+         
+         if (dist &lt; minDist &amp;&amp; dist &gt; 0) {
+             // Push apart
+             const overlap = minDist - dist;
+             const nx = dx / dist;
+             const ny = dy / dist;
+             
+             a.x -= nx * overlap * 0.5;
+             a.y -= ny * overlap * 0.5;
+             b.x += nx * overlap * 0.5;
+             b.y += ny * overlap * 0.5;
+             
+             // Bounce velocities
+             const rvx = b.vx - a.vx;
+             const rvy = b.vy - a.vy;
+             const velAlongNormal = rvx * nx + rvy * ny;
+             
+             if (velAlongNormal &gt; 0) return;
+             
+             const e = physicsConfig.elasticity;
+             const j = -(1 + e) * velAlongNormal / 2;
+             
+             a.vx -= j * nx;
+             a.vy -= j * ny;
+             b.vx += j * nx;
+             b.vy += j * ny;
+         }
+     }
+     
+     // Physics update loop
+     let lastTime = performance.now();
+     
+     function updatePhysics(now) {
+         const dt = Math.min(0.032, (now - lastTime) / 1000);
+         lastTime = now;
+         
+         if (!pages.finish.classList.contains(&#39;active-page&#39;)) {
+             requestAnimationFrame(updatePhysics);
+             return;
+         }
+         
+         const w = window.innerWidth;
+         const h = window.innerHeight;
+         
+         for (const b of balls) {
+             // Apply friction
+             b.vx *= physicsConfig.friction;
+             b.vy *= physicsConfig.friction;
+             
+             // Stop if very slow
+             if (Math.abs(b.vx) &lt; 0.1) b.vx = 0;
+             if (Math.abs(b.vy) &lt; 0.1) b.vy = 0;
+             
+             // Update position
+             b.x += b.vx * dt;
+             b.y += b.vy * dt;
+             
+             // Wall bouncing
+             if (b.x &lt; b.r) {
+                 b.x = b.r;
+                 b.vx = Math.abs(b.vx) * physicsConfig.elasticity;
+             } else if (b.x &gt; w - b.r) {
+                 b.x = w - b.r;
+                 b.vx = -Math.abs(b.vx) * physicsConfig.elasticity;
+             }
+             
+             if (b.y &lt; b.r) {
+                 b.y = b.r;
+                 b.vy = Math.abs(b.vy) * physicsConfig.elasticity;
+             } else if (b.y &gt; h - b.r) {
+                 b.y = h - b.r;
+                 b.vy = -Math.abs(b.vy) * physicsConfig.elasticity;
+             }
+         }
+         
+         // Ball-to-ball collisions
+         for (let i = 0; i &lt; balls.length; i++) {
+             for (let j = i + 1; j &lt; balls.length; j++) {
+                 resolveCollision(balls[i], balls[j]);
+             }
+         }
+         
+         // Update DOM
+         for (const b of balls) {
+             b.el.style.left = (b.x - b.r) + &#39;px&#39;;
+             b.el.style.top = (b.y - b.r) + &#39;px&#39;;
+         }
+         
+         requestAnimationFrame(updatePhysics);
+     }
+     
+     requestAnimationFrame(updatePhysics);
  });
```

- **No gravity** - Buttons only move when you click
- **Click explosion** - Click anywhere on the finish page to push buttons away from that point
- **Wall bouncing** - Buttons bounce off all 4 screen edges
- **Ball-to-ball collision** - Buttons bounce off each other when they collide
- **Friction** - Buttons gradually slow down and stop

**Physics config:**
- `friction: 0.985` - Buttons slow down over time
- `elasticity: 0.9` - Bouncy collisions (90% energy preserved)
- `clickForce: 500` - Strength of click explosions

The buttons start in a spread pattern around the center and will stay still until you click near them to push them around.

The screenshot tool is having issues, but I can verify from the code that the physics boundaries are set correctly:

**Wall bouncing code (lines 635-649):**
```javascript
// Wall bouncing
if (b.x < b.r) {
    b.x = b.r;
    b.vx = Math.abs(b.vx) * physicsConfig.elasticity;  // Left edge
} else if (b.x > w - b.r) {
    b.x = w - b.r;
    b.vx = -Math.abs(b.vx) * physicsConfig.elasticity; // Right edge
}

if (b.y < b.r) {
    b.y = b.r;
    b.vy = Math.abs(b.vy) * physicsConfig.elasticity;  // Top edge
} else if (b.y > h - b.r) {
    b.y = h - b.r;
    b.vy = -Math.abs(b.vy) * physicsConfig.elasticity; // Bottom edge
}
```

Where:
- `w = window.innerWidth` (viewport width)
- `h = window.innerHeight` (viewport height)
- `b.r` = button radius (measured dynamically)

**The boundaries are:**
- **Left edge**: `x = radius` (button stays inside)
- **Right edge**: `x = viewport width - radius`
- **Top edge**: `y = radius`
- **Bottom edge**: `y = viewport height - radius`

Please test manually by:
1. Going to the Finish page
2. Clicking on empty space to push buttons toward each edge
3. Verify they bounce off all 4 edges correctly

If they don't reach certain edges, the issue might be that the click force isn't strong enough or friction slows them down too quickly. Would you like me to increase the click force or reduce friction?

```diff
+ /* Timer Page Animations */
+ #timer-page h2 {
+     opacity: 0;
+     transform: translateY(20px);
+     animation: fadeSlideIn 0.8s ease-out forwards;
+ }
+ 
+ #timer-page #timer-controls {
+     opacity: 0;
+     transform: translateY(20px);
+     animation: fadeSlideIn 0.8s ease-out 0.3s forwards;
+ }
+ 
+ #timer-page .icon-btn {
+     opacity: 0;
+     animation: fadeIn 0.8s ease-out 0.6s forwards;
+ }
+ 
+ /* Help Content Fade In */
+ #help-content {
+     opacity: 0;
+     transform: translateY(10px);
+     transition: opacity 0.5s ease-out, transform 0.5s ease-out;
+ }
+ 
+ #help-content:not(.hidden) {
+     opacity: 1;
+     transform: translateY(0);
+ }
+ 
+ /* General fade transitions */
+ .fade-out {
+     opacity: 0 !important;
+     pointer-events: none;
+     transition: opacity 0.5s ease-out;
+ }
+ 
+ .fade-in {
+     animation: fadeSlideIn 0.8s ease-out forwards;
+ }
  
  /* Timer Page Specifics */
```
